text:
Why is there no Altseason? 

$125 billion has been liquidated in leverage this year alone.  If that capital went into spot assets instead:

- No thin liquidity across the market

- No cascade that results in market crashes

- Less selling pressure

- We could have a total crypto MCAP of $5-$6T today

Leverage is killing the bull. Spot HODL is the real season.

What if......

$NVDA CEO Jensen Huang clarified he never said China will ‚Äúwin‚Äù the AI race but just that they‚Äôre moving fast with half the world‚Äôs AI researchers & top open-source models.

Speed is the new moat in AI & the U.S. can‚Äôt afford to lose it.

I've been adding a ton of $META on this pullback.

Market still values Meta like a cyclical ad platform even though it has evolved into one of the largest AI compute platforms on earth built inside the most engaged network ever created.

Meta now reaches 3.5B people every day, Reels monetization is scaling with time spent already above Facebook Feed & its AI agents are about to turn every app in the family into a discovery & commerce engine.

20x forward earnings for a company compounding like this makes no sense so I‚Äôll keep adding while everyone else hesitates.

$NVDA CEO Jensen Huang clarified that Blackwell chips will not be shipped to China & that his ‚ÄúChina will win‚Äù comment referred to their technical capabilities, not Nvidia‚Äôs alignment.

He added that any future return to the market depends entirely on China‚Äôs policy decisions.

$ASTS & Vodafone are building their main European Satellite Operations Centre in Germany as part of a new constellation that will connect phones directly to satellites across Europe.

The goal is full mobile broadband coverage and emergency connectivity by 2026.

$IREN CEO said demand now exceeds the 200MW already contracted with $MSFT. 

It shows more hyperscalers are lining up for capacity as IREN‚Äôs AI infrastructure turns into one of the few scalable power & compute platforms left to lock in.

$AMSC American Superconductor falls 15%  as their quarterly EPS misses rev targets by $1.33M. For the third quarter ending December 31, 2025, AMSC expects that its revenues will be in the range of $65.0 million to $70.0 million

$DUOL Duolingo plunged after the company issued a softer-than-expected Q4 bookings outlook despite beating Q3 earnings estimates. The company guided Q4 bookings to $329.5M‚Äì$335.5M, below the $344.1M consensus.

$ELF e.l.f. Beauty falls 21%  after the company issued an FY2026 outlook that pointed to notable profit compression. We've had Unusual Option Activity‚Ñ¢ in $ELF & today's drop helped us ring the register BIGLY!

$SNAP Snap +20% - Shares surged after they reported stronger-than-expected Q3 results and issued an upbeat Q4 outlook, alongside announcing a major AI partnership with Perplexity. Daily active users reached 477M (+7.7% Y/Y) & we had UOA in it!

$FSLY Fastly +16% - Shares jumped after the edge-cloud platform reported an earnings beat and issued a stronger-than-expected revenue outlook. For Q4, Fastly guided revenue to $159M‚Äì$163M, implying ~15% Y/Y growth at the midpoint.
I can't even imagine what a 10% correction would look like üòÇ

Meanwhile, US-China try to patch things up: China may loosen rare earth export controls & boost US farm imports in return for tariff cuts. So: rare earths vs soy, geopolitics in 3D chess.
Oil trading sideways: Brent ~$65, $WTI ~$60. OPEC+ agreed to a tiny output bump (137k bpd) then a ‚Äúpause‚Äù in Q1. Demand weak, dollar strong. Oil may have commitment issues.
